description.narrative: The Samoa Inclusive Education Demonstration Program (SIEDP)main focus is to enable students with disability make the transition from primary to secondary school with a key objective, to demonstrate a model of service provision for girls and boys with disability for inclusive education which can be replicated and supported by the Government of Samoa in its future program development. Activities to be undertaken across five years will include: support, resources and information for parents, families and communities; early intervention and support services; teacher support and up skilling; further development of the enabling environment in Samoa for inclusive education; and ongoing program management and learning. SIEDP will initially be managed by SENESE for the first year with assistance of an in-line position based in the Ministry of Education, Sports and Culture (MESC). In July 2015 funding will then be directed through the Government of Samoa through Investment INK306 sector budget
